BHARTIYA JANTA PARTY (BJP) Bhatiya Janta Party (BJP) was born with the third division in Janta Party on 6th April, 1980. On April 4, 1980 the National Executive of the Janta Party passed a resolution and imposed a ban on the members of the party for having any type of relation with R.S.S. But the members of the Jan Sangh Group of party did not accept this decision. The leaders of ex-Jan Sangh group decided to form a separate new party. The former information Minister of the Janta Government, Mr. Lal Krishan Advani called a national convention of ex. Janojh Group in Delhi on 5th-6th April 1980. About 4383 representatives drawn from 21 states took part in this convention. On 6th April 1980 a new party named Bhartiya Janta Party came into being in this conference and Sh. Atal Bihari Vajpayee was unanimously elected the president of the Party. It was also decided in the convention that that party flag will consist of Green Saffron in vertical sections. PARTY SYMBOL AND PRESIDENT: The Party Symbol is lotus and Sh. Jagat Prakash Nadda is the president of BJP.
